data.message: How come the option to translate languages is no longer available?

replies.message: Hi Matt. You can download a guide for using the Translations app. You can also find a link to the guide in the Translation app by going to Useful Translations Links on the the right side and clicking Translation App Guide. Learn more: https://www.facebook.com/help/1487656711511882 -Chantal
Did this work for you Matt?  I tried the link but it said it was not for android phones.  I have a galaxy S3.
No it did not work, it says not for iPads???

I find this only works on my Macbook Pro or PC... never on my ipad or iphone.  Bummer since I have family oversees who communicate among themselves in their native language. I have to wait till I can log in on my computer to get the translation.
It was working on my PC, iPad and android until about a month ago. I also have family overseas and I would use the translate feature all the time. Now I have to cut and past into Google translate.
If I worked for Facebook, I'd have responded in German.
